headline: The Psalm of Fluorescent Hours
description: A psalm of endurance written under artificial light. The speaker endures the fluorescent hum of labor while seeking God in the mundane wilderness. Through repetition and irony, the poem turns exhaustion into devotionâ€”faith under industrial light. It sanctifies the workday as a trial of the spirit, a desert of modern man, and an offering of trust.

motifMap.meaning: Fluorescent light as sterile divinityâ€”illumination without warmth.
The spiritual test of enduranceâ€”faith in scarcity.
Labor made ritual; mundane repetition as prayer.
The false paradise of comfortâ€”the soulâ€™s refusal of ease.
Faith in miracleâ€”the hope that even hardness yields grace.
